entities.name: poison
entities.description: The poison in the snake's fangs that keeps wounds open.

entities.name: antidote
entities.description: A cure for the poison, which they are confident will be found.

entities.name: blood-replenishing potion
entities.description: A treatment that needs to be taken every hour to counteract the effects of the poison.

entities.name: werewolf
entities.description: A condition where a person transforms into a wolf-like creature during full moon.

entities.name: healers
entities.description: Medical professionals who are trying to help the werewolf patient.

entities.name: mr. weasley
entities.description: A person who is talking about a werewolf he knows personally.

entities.name: george
entities.description: The son of Mr. Weasley, who asks what the werewolf patient said in response to Mr. Weasley's words.

relationships.description: The antidote is a cure for the poison.
The blood-replenishing potion is a treatment for the effects of the poison.
The werewolf patient is being treated by the healers.
Mr. Weasley knows a werewolf personally.
George is the son of Mr. Weasley.
The healers are treating the werewolf patient.
